result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray Anthony Stribling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; If the defendant is revoked defendant is to serve the first 6 months, STRAIGHT TIME and remainder of sentence with Huber privileges.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ray Anthony Stribling

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter from CIty of Milwaukee received and filed.
Letter from Adams Law Group received and filed.
Order GRANTING Property Return ($499) signed and filed.  Copies to the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County and petitioner's attorney.
Letter from Office of Corporation Counsel received and filed.
Declaration received and filed.
Affidavit received and filed.

Petitioner Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  City of Milwaukee and State of Wisconsin appear by Assistant District Attorney Nicholas Perry DeSiato.  Also present in court is Milwaukee County Corporate Counsel Attorney Dewey Martin.  Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Statements made.  Court grants petition, City of Milwaukee Police and Milwaukee County Sheriff Departments are both ordered to return any property of the defendant's in their possession.  Order to be submitted by the petitioner's attorney on a later date.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams via email.  Nicholas Perry DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on property hearing, however defense is out of state and not able to appear in person.  Case adjourned and remains calendared in Branch 22.  Return of property hearing scheduled for December 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Nick Perry DeSiato appeared for the City of Milwaukee.
Return on property hearing proceeded.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court orders case adjourned for return of property hearing with potential testimony.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Return of property hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return of property hearing on October 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
MPD Incident report # 1600040132.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Signed INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE & ACKNOWLEDGMENT provided to defendant.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Sentencing proceeded..  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Tara A.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.
If the defendant is revoked defendant to serve first 6 months straight time and remainder of sentence with huber privileges.

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash bail on deposit
Defense Sentencing Memorandum, received and filed

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 06/13/2016 is vacated.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Original MOTION HEARING Transcript (43 pages) commencing 04-14-2016 received and filed. CH

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Ryan DeWitt.   Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress.   Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Supplemental Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress Evidence

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing JANUARY 14, 2016 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ADAMS URFER, LLC  ATTORNEY DANIEL MORGAN ADAMS  735 WEST WISCONSIN AVENUE  SUITE 725  MILWAUKEE, WISCONSIN, 53233.
Supplemental Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing.  Additional legal issues have arisen, Court orders parties brief these.    Defense motions due 03/15/2016, state's reply due 03/29/2016.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State's response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress. Received and filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests motion hearing date.  Defense motions due 02/08/16, state's reply due 02/26/2016.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Dennis Murphy for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Ryan DeWitt MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Bond continued as previously set.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ray Anthony Stribling in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/8/16 @ 1:30p
